description: Rosamund Pike and Dior deserved another awards season 2024 moment together after her “Elspeth at the funeral” look broke the internet. But if that inky black lace dress – and exquisitely moody face net – was a darkly romantic nod to Pike’s Saltburn character, her BAFTAs look is quintessentially Rosamund.

description: With Labour changing its stance and backing an immediate ceasefire, here's where the main UK parties stand on the Gaza conflict.

title: Tories could still win next election, Starmer warns in Glasgow speech
description: Keir Starmer has warned the Tories could still win the next UK general election – despite the party consistently polling around 20 points ahead of their rivals. Speaking to Scottish Labour members on the last day of the party’s conference in Glasgow, the Labour leader took aim at the SNP for claiming Labour is almost certain to win the next ballot.

title: Sir Keir Starmer says North Sea oil and gas will continue ‘for decades to come’ during Scottish Labour Party speech
description: Sir Keir Starmer has insisted work in the North Sea oil and gas sector will continue “for decades to come” as his party continues to face criticism from the industry. It came as the UK Labour leader made a direct appeal to Scots who “have found a new political home with the SNP” to return to his party.

title: Keir Starmer pledges North Sea oil and gas work will continue for ‘decades to come’ — full speech
description: Keir Starmer has pledged North Sea oil and gas will continue to provide jobs in Scotland “for decades to come”. He also committed his party to creating a publicly-owned energy company headquartered in Scotland if it wins the general election later this year.

title: Rishi Sunak says his plan is working - after another shambolic week, does anyone believe him?
description: The leader of the opposition was criticised for not acting quickly enough over the situation. He insisted that he took "decisive action", but Martin Forde - who led the 2022 review into antisemitism in the Labour Party - said the handling of the Rochdale situation had been "pretty shambolic". Matters were to get worse, however.

title: Lorna Creswell's Glitz 'n' Glam birthday party at Forres Town Hall promotes local businesses and groups

title: Protest over Gaza disrupts Cambridge City Council budget meeting
description: Protesters disrupted the city council’s budget meeting to urge it to call for an immediate ceasefire in Gaza. Members of the public chanted “ceasefire now”, preventing the meeting last Thursday (February 15) from continuing.

title: Adam Boulton: Sunak's by-election nightmare, Starmer's Rochdale headache, and why a May election is a distinct possibility...
description: Sir Keir Starmer's Labour Party has now broken into the record books with six by-election gains from the Conservatives following big wins in Kingswood and Wellingborough, but the tables will be turned at the upcoming Rochdale by-election.

title: Cambridge City Council agrees 2.99% council tax rise after Labour knocks back Lib Dem proposals
description: Cambridge City Council has agreed a 2.99 per cent increase to its portion of the council tax bill in a budget that includes a £1million for a redesign of its Guildhall headquarters. It means the ‘average’ Band D household will pay £225.39 to the Labour-run council for the year from April, up £6.54.
